tests.text: You should declare a variable named expenses_from_category in your elif clause.

Your expenses_from_category variable should come after the print() call.
tests.testString: ({ test: () => assert(runPython(`_Node(_code).find_function("main").find_whiles()[0].find_bodies()[0].find_ifs()[0].find_bodies()[3].is_equivalent("category = input('Enter category to filter: ')\\nprint(f'\\\\nExpenses for {category}:')\\nexpenses_from_category = filter_expenses_by_category(expenses, category)")`)) })

description: After your print() call, you need to filter the expenses and print the filtered list. Declare a variable expenses_from_category and assign it a call to filter_expenses_by_category passing expenses and category as the argument.
